value.title: Biden revokes Trump executive orders targeting TikTok and WeChat
value.excerpt: President Biden has revoked former President Trump’s executive orders that sought to ban downloads of the Chinese-owned apps TikTok and WeChat in the U.S., according to a fact sheet released by the White House Wednesday.

value.title: HUD to reinstate Obama-era fair housing rule gutted under Trump — minus the ‘burdensome’ reporting requirement
value.excerpt: Biden's housing department is restoring the requirement that communities take steps to reduce racial segregation or risk losing federal funds. But missing from the requirement is the 2015 mandate that communities undergo an extensive analysis of local barriers to integration and submit plans to dismantle them to the Department of Housing and Urban Development.

value.title: Kwame Kilpatrick Explains 'Catalyst' Behind Donald Trump Cutting His Jail Time
value.excerpt: The former Detroit mayor said he dropped to his knees when he learned that Trump was freeing him from prison in one of his last acts in office.

value.title: Trump backs Nigeria banning Twitter, calls for other countries to follow
value.excerpt: Former President Trump on Tuesday applauded Nigeria’s Twitter ban and called on other countries to follow suit.

value.title: ‘MediaBuzz’ on Facebook’s Trump ban, media treatment of Biden
value.excerpt: What drives me crazy about the media is that when they totally blow it, an all-out, no doubt deep-rooted red-faced botching of a major story, they barely acknowledge it before moving on. You read the coverage now of the circumstantial evidence of the Wuhan lab as the original source of the COVID scourge and there's this flat,

value.title: Fed lawyers: Trump not liable for 'crude' remarks at accuser
value.excerpt: Justice Department lawyers say Donald Trump cannot be held personally liable for “crude and disrespectful” remarks he made while president about a woman who accused him of rape

value.title: Donald Trump calls Bitcoin 'a scam against the dollar'
value.excerpt: Former US President Donald Trump has told Fox Business that he sees Bitcoin as a "scam" affecting the value of the US dollar. "Bitcoin, it just seems like a scam," Mr Trump said. "I don't like it because it's another currency competing against the dollar.

value.title: A refugee agency rebuilds its pipeline after Trump: 'We're starting from scratch'
value.excerpt: RELATED: Faith-based refugee resettlement groups describe what it will take to rebuild program after Trump cuts Friends and family collected winter coats for the girl and dropped off a stack of Christmas presents.

value.title: Fact check: Donald Trump remains suspended from Facebook, Instagram
value.excerpt: An Instagram post claims Donald Trump's Facebook and Instagram accounts were restored as of June 2. That's false.

value.title: Coach v the White House: inside Steve Kerr’s extraordinary feud with Donald Trump
value.excerpt: In a new book about the Golden State Warriors coach, Scott Howard-Cooper explores how the NBA, China and the US president combined for an explosive mix

value.title: Trump adviser Lewandowski: he ‘lost the election’ and will not be reinstated
value.excerpt: Former campaign manager tells Fox News Sunday there is no mechanism by which a loser can return to the White House

value.title: Blunt: Trump should be 'focused' on 2022, not the past
value.excerpt: In an exclusive interview with Meet the Press, Sen. Roy Blunt (R-Mo.), Chair, Republican Policy Committee, encourages former President Donald Trump to stop relitigating 2020.

value.title: Trump: 'Too soon to tell' if Pence would be running mate if he seeks White House in 2024
value.excerpt: Former President Trump Donald Trump Trump touts record, blasts Dems in return to stage Trump demands China pay 'reparations' for role in coronavirus pandemic Trump endorses Rep. Ted Budd for ...

value.title: Trump to GOP: Support candidates who 'stand for our values'
value.excerpt: Former President Donald Trump is pushing Republicans to support those candidates who share his values in next year’s midterm elections as he launches a new more active phase of his post presidency

value.title: Donald Trump, Assault Weapons, Prom: Your Weekend Briefing
value.excerpt: Donald Trump began his next act Saturday night at the North Carolina Republican convention. In a 90-minute speech, Mr. Trump ran through a litany of conservative culture war issues and ended with an extended frontal attack on voting and American democracy in which he endorsed a long list of Republican voter suppression proposals.

value.title: China, Fauci and hoaxes: Donald Trump targets usual suspects in return to stage
value.excerpt: Former president seeks limelight ahead of midterms, calling on China to pay Covid reparations and dismissing criminal inquiries into his business dealings

value.title: Trump speech in NC, East Coast heat wave, Belmont Stakes: 5 things to know this weekend
value.excerpt: Former President Donald Trump will return to the political stage, a heat wave is expected to scorch the East Coast and more news to start your weekend

value.title: Ted Lieu Doesn't 'Understand Why Mike Pence Is Even Talking' To Donald Trump After Capitol Riot
value.excerpt: "Mike Pence didn't have the courage to do what should have been done to protect our Country and our Constitution," Trump tweeted as Capitol rioters chanted "Hang Mike Pence."

value.title: Arizona Republican who ordered election audit touted Trump phone call, Giuliani support in emails
value.excerpt: Karen Fann, the state Senate president, also told a constituent that "Biden won," according to the messages obtained and released by a watchdog group.

value.title: McEnany: Women in Biden admin get 'glowing' profiles after 'hit pieces' for female Trump officials
value.excerpt: Former White House press secretary Kayleigh McEnany responded Friday to reports that successor Jen Psaki was having her picture taken by celebrity photographer Annie Leibovitz for a magazine profile.

value.title: Next stop on Donald Trump’s political comeback tour: Dallas in July for CPAC
value.excerpt: Donald Trump will be in Dallas in July to appear at a major conservative gathering, organizers said Thursday — a fresh spotlight in a

value.title: After 2-year battle, House panel to interview Trump counsel McGahn
value.excerpt: His interview with the Judiciary Committee comes two years after House Democrats originally sought his testimony as part of investigations into former President Donald Trump.

value.title: Pence: I'll likely never see eye to eye with Trump on Jan. 6
value.excerpt: Former Vice President Mike Pence says he isn't sure he and former President Donald Trump will ever see “eye to eye” over what happened on Jan_ 6 but he will “always be proud of what we accomplished for the American people over the last four years.

value.title: Trump's grip on GOP sparks fears about democratic process
value.excerpt: Many Republicans, led by Donald Trump, are continuing to question the validity of the 2020 election, and critics say that denial shows how the party is increasingly open to bucking democratic norms

value.title: Pence says he and Trump don’t ‘see eye to eye’ on Jan. 6 — but GOP ‘must move forward’
value.excerpt: In a speech in New Hampshire, former Vice President Mike Pence urged Republicans to move forward following the Capitol riot.

value.title: FLASHBACK: Ted Koppel predicted CNN ratings 'would be in the toilet without Donald Trump'
value.excerpt: Veteran journalist Ted Koppel said “CNN's ratings would be in the toilet without Donald Trump” in a 2018 interview, words that appear prescient as the liberal network's numbers continue to fall without its nemesis in office.

value.title: Republican leaders to summit with Trump over conservative agenda
value.excerpt: Republican Study Committee Chairman Jim Banks and other members of the largest Republican caucus’ leadership will hold a summit with former President Donald Trump in New Jersey next week.

value.title: Jimmy Kimmel on Trump abandoning his blog: ‘It’s a move he calls the Eric’
value.excerpt: With most late-night hosts on holiday this week, Kimmel mocks the end of Trump’s short-lived website and Amazon’s new cannabis policy

value.title: Washington Post op-ed claims media 'no longer needs Trump' despite nonstop coverage of former POTUS
value.excerpt: Washington Post columnist Paul Waldman made a questionable claim that the media "no longer needs" Donald Trump despite the continued coverage the former president still receives more than four months after leaving office.
